content: Investments Stocks Standard Chartered Online Trading DBS Vickers Securities Asked by Caleb Seah Hua XiangAsked on 29 Apr 2019Does anyone know how to transfer your shares from SCB Online Trading to DBS Vickers or my Own CDP?How much does it cost and what's the proper procedure to do it? Is it chargable by Per Stock basis?2 answersAnswerBump0

TWTay WenHaoLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 01 May 2019Im using DBS Vickers and from what I know its directly transferred to CDP account. Not held by 'custodian' aka DBS0 comments1

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 01 May 2019Yes is charged by stock counter about $10.70 incl gst.Open a CDP account.Get the share transfer form from SCB and fill up. It will take a while to finish the process from filling in to receiving in CDP.0 comments0
